snippet: The two largest European economies that do not use the euro announced measures to help shelter their countries from the debt crisis that has engulfed Greece and Spain.
abstract: Britain and Switzerland, the two largest European economies that do not use the euro, announce measures to help shelter their countries from the debt crisis that has engulfed Greece and Spain; Britain unveils plans for a special bank-financing effort to increase business lending, while Switzerland says it is ready to take action to keep the value of the Swiss franc from rising further.

byline.original: By JULIA WERDIGIER and DAVID JOLLY
byline.contributor: Julia Werdigier reported from London and David Jolly from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The two largest European economies that do not use the euro announced measures to help shelter their countries from the debt crisis that has engulfed Greece and Spain.

headline.main: Switzerland and Britain Gird Against the Storm
